title: M.S. Swaminathan, agricultural scientist who helped feed India, dies at 98
description: As a mastermind of India’s Green Revolution in the 1960s, he was credited with saving millions of people from starvation.

title: Teen arrested after felling of famous Sycamore Gap tree on Hadrian’s Wall
description: Police said that a deliberate act of vandalism may have brought down what is perhaps England’s most-photographed tree, the Sycamore Gap tree on Hadrian’s Wall.

title: China takes back pandas from zoos in U.S., U.K.
description: Is China shifting its approach to “panda diplomacy”? Zoos in some Western countries — including in the National Zoo in D.C. — face the prospect of losing all their pandas by next year.

title: A crown branded onto bodies links British monarchy to slave trade
description: Documents found by a British researcher and republished by The Washington Post show evidence of the monarchy’s intimate role in the transatlantic slave trade.

title: U.N. criticizes French move to bar Olympians from wearing headscarves
description: France won’t let athletes wear hijabs at the 2024 Paris Olympics. “No one should impose on a woman what she needs to wear or not wear,” a U.N. spokeswoman said.

title: Chinese property giant Evergrande’s slow implosion nears crunch time
description: The spate of bad news suggests that troubled property giant Evergrande, China’s most indebted company, might be heading toward liquidation.

title: Defeated by force, Nagorno-Karabakh government declares it will dissolve
description: Conquered by Azerbaijan in a swift military operation last week, the breakaway republic, which Armenians call Artsakh, will cease to exist on Jan. 1, its president said.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Trudeau apologizes after Nazi veteran honored; Kremlin critic sent to ‘strictest’ jail
description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau was “unaware of the context” when Parliament honored a Ukrainian with Nazi roots. Jailed activist Alexei Navalny faces harsher imprisonment.

title: How the war in Ukraine helped stoke an Armenian tragedy
description: For Moscow, the havoc befalling the residents of Nagorno-Karabakh marks a loss of prestige.
